text:
I don't rem where I saw it, but I recall there was a way to reduce optimization level of julia compiler from default `-02` to speed it up.
How would I do this in vscode?

text: You should be able to add that to the `julia.additionalArgs` setting

text: Ok I see. But I also forgot the flag name. Do you remember it?

elements.text: Ok I see. But I also forgot the flag name. Do you remember it?

text: It is `-O{0, 1, 2, 3}` as in your original message. Or `--optimize={0, 1, 2, 3}`. You can see it with `julia --help`
